short_description: Discover Christmas Island, an Australian territory in the Indian Ocean known for its spectacular red crab migration, unique wildlife, pristine beaches, and stunning natural beauty. Experience world-class diving, explore lush rainforests, and witness one of nature's greatest migrations.

health.tap_water_safety: Safe to drink - excellent water quality
alcohol_info: It is prohibited to sell, serve, or offer alcohol beverages to anyone under the age of 18
Alcohol can be purchased from licensed venues, restaurants, and stores

tipping.hotels: Tipping is not mandatory but appreciated for exceptional service
tipping.guides: 10-15% tip is appreciated for tour guides
tipping.restaurants: Tipping is not mandatory but 10% is appreciated for good service
tipping.taxis: Tipping is not expected but rounding up the fare is common

weather.title: Christmas Island has a tropical equatorial climate with warm temperatures year-round. The island experiences two distinct seasons: a dry season from May to November and a wet season from December to April, with the wet season bringing the famous red crab migration.

when_to_visit.title: Red Crab Migration
when_to_visit.short_description: Witness the spectacular red crab migration, one of nature's greatest spectacles. Millions of red crabs migrate from the forest to the coast to spawn. This is a unique and unforgettable experience

when_to_visit.title: Dry Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Perfect weather with low humidity, minimal rainfall, and warm temperatures. Ideal for diving, snorkeling, hiking, and outdoor activities. Best time for exploring the island's natural beauty

when_to_visit.title: Wet Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Higher humidity and more frequent rain showers. The wet season brings the red crab migration, making it a unique time to visit. Still possible to enjoy activities between rain showers

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Christmas Island is during the dry season from May to November for ideal weather, or during October to December to witness the spectacular red crab migration
